intro: Parasenecio ainsliaeiflorus, commonly known as the Ainsliaea-flowered parasenecio, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is known for its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in late summer and early autumn. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun exposure. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
